body:
Comment 1 by **darkgray**: 
Tried printing my time zone in Python, and it too returns WEST in Windows. Turns out
this is Microsoft's way of referring to CET, I guess? Running "tzutil /g" at the command
prompt gives me "W. Europe Standard Time", whatever the hell that is.

Wikipedia's only entry on WEST (as time zone) is
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_European_Summer_Time and these are apparently not
the same thing, hence my confusion. I guess the issue isn't an issue with Go so much as
with Windows.

Sorry to bother you!
